alert.note: Alert for Buncombe; Greater Rutherford; Henderson; Rutherford Mountains; Yancey (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 25 at 5:45AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of McDowell, northern Rutherford, north central Henderson, eastern Buncombe, southeastern Yancey and southwestern Burke Counties through 630 AM EDT... At 545 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles south of Burnsville to 9 miles east of Downtown Asheville to 10 miles west of Hendersonville. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Morganton, Marion, Arden, Black Mountain, Swannanoa, Fairview In Buncombe County, Glen Alpine, Old Fort, B.R. Parkway-Craggy To Little Switzerland and Lake James State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Buncombe; Greater Rutherford; Henderson; Rutherford Mountains; Yancey
